description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

v0.1.1.description:
First Public Release
- Added FW (Full Game)
- Changed some of the stupid filler
v0.1.1.title: THMusic v0.1.1

v0.1.2.description:
Small update but game breaking changes I should've done on release:
- Removed StB: Wind God Girl (It is identical to MoF: Wind God Girl)
- Moved the 30th Final Boss Completed from "SSiB: Watatsuki's Spell Card ~ Lunatic Blue" to "FW: Because I'm Used to Being the Last One Left ~ Stone Goddess"
v0.1.2.title: THMusic v0.1.2

v0.1.3.description:
Reorganised a bunch of stuff again, definitely incompatible with previous versions.
Hopefully this will be the last tweak update for a while.
- Reorganised the track order for UNL, HM and SFW to better reflect their OST releases.
- Removed Unrelated filler items.
- Added new filler items.
- Reworded some traps..
v0.1.3.title: THMusic v0.1.3

v0.1.4.description:
This was the update that was meant to release before the music Async
Changes:
- Renamed Locations for SaBND and OSP
- Updated Translation
- Changed Item Categories
- Changed quantities of some traps
- Added new filler
- Added archipelago.json, and support for 0.6.4/0.7.0
v0.1.4.title: THMusic v0.1.4

v0.1.5r2.description:
Small Logic Adjustments
- Giant Catfish is now required for Unknown X
- MS Peaceful Romancer now needs the Extra unlock
- New Fillers
v0.1.5r2.title: THMusic v0.1.5
